channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: France Suggests It Would Not Immediately Arrest Netanyahu Despite I.C.C. Warrant
item.description: The foreign ministry did not say outright that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel would be free to travel to France, but it argued that an I....

item.title: Volunteering programs are probably the most powerful well-being benefit in your toolkit: ‘It’s a big competitive advantage from a talent perspective’
item.description: Employees who partake are more connected, engaged, and satisfied with their jobs.

item.title: Britain’s Emotional Debate Over Assisted Dying.
item.description: As lawmakers prepare to vote on legalizing assisted suicide for the terminally ill in England and Wales, an intense public discussion has unfolded.

item.title: 3 Americans Are Said to Be Freed From China in Prisoner Swap
item.description: The three men, John Leung, Kai Li and Mark Swidan, are on planes heading to the United States, officials said.

item.title: A Battered and Diminished Hezbollah Accepts a Ceasefire
item.description: Thirteen months of war left Hezbollah weakened, isolated and desperate for a way to stop the fighting.

item.title: Live Updates: Lebanon Sends Troops to Support Cease-Fire as Thousands of Civilians Head South
item.description: The Lebanese Army said it was deploying forces near the Israeli border as a U.S.-backed truce between Israel and Hezbollah militants began to take eff...

item.title: Marsh McLennan’s CIO started with a summer job in 1995. He never left and now leads a team of more than 5,000 technologists
item.description: CIO Paul Beswick leads a team of more than 5,000 technologists and says a key area of focus is ensuring all four of Marsh McLennan business divisions ...

item.title: Maine Becomes the Latest State to Sue Oil Companies Over Climate Change
item.description: In a new lawsuit, the state’s attorney general claims oil companies deceived the public about fossil fuel products’ contributions to climate change.

item.title: Deutsche Bank warns Trump tariffs could stop Jerome Powell from cutting Fed rates at all next year
item.description: Trump tariffs could prove to be the pin that pops the bubble on Fed cuts next year.

item.title: Record Number of Travelers Expected Over Thanksgiving Week
item.description: Bad weather threatens roads over the holiday, but security lines were moving quickly at Chicago’s main airport on Tuesday.

item.title: Marc Andreessen tells Joe Rogan that Silicon Valley is split in half following Trump’s win: ‘There’s now two kinds of dinner parties’
item.description: Venture capitalist Marc Andreessen no longer makes the guest list of every dinner party in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Lebanese Cheer On a Cease-Fire as Thousands Return to Their Homes
item.description: Under the cease-fire agreement, Israel will withdraw its forces from Lebanon over the next 60 days, while Hezbollah will retreat from southern Lebanon...

item.title: Britain’s Emotional Debate Over Assisted Dying.
item.description: As lawmakers prepare to vote on legalizing assisted suicide for the terminally ill in England and Wales, an intense public discussion has unfolded.

item.title: PCE, a Key Inflation Measure, Sped Up in October
item.description: Inflation has been stubborn in recent months. Now, President-elect Donald J. Trump’s tariffs loom as a potential risk.
